case_title: Judicial-VIII) SHER AFGHAN vs MUHAMMAD RAFIQ and another

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Rafique
allegation: Misuse and illegal sale of Shamilat Land

complaint_summary: Sher Afghan filed an appeal challenging the mutation proceedings and sale of Shamilat Land by Muhammad Rafique.
investigation_summary: The mutation proceedings were reviewed, revealing that Muhammad Rafique sold his share of Shamilat Land without consulting co-sharers, violating Section 136 of The Land Revenue Act, 1967.

judgment_summary.restriction_on_sale: Sale of Shamilat land is restricted
judgment_summary.future_guidelines: Shamilat land must be preserved for community use and sustainability

punishment: Mutation No. 2016 dated 30-6-2009 canceled; sale of Shamilat Land restricted.
legal_arguments: Violation of Section 136 of The Land Revenue Act, 1967.
Mandatory consultation with co-sharers not conducted.
Shamilat Land intended for community welfare and future generations.
assets: Shamilat Land of village Jamroat Khalan, Tehsil Gujar Khan
key_issues: Misuse and illegal sale of Shamilat Land
Preservation of community assets for future generations

maxims.Sustainability: Present generation must preserve community assets for future generations.

legal_terms.Shamilat Land: Common land reserved for community welfare.
legal_terms.Mutation: Legal process of transferring ownership of land.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the misuse and illegal sale of Shamilat Land by Muhammad Rafique, violating Section 136 of The Land Revenue Act, 1967. The court emphasized the importance of preserving community assets for future generations and restricted the sale of Shamilat Land.

issues.public_interest: Shamilat land must be preserved for community welfare and future generations

directions.tehsildar: Tehsildar Gujar Khan is directed to incorporate the judgment in the Revenue Record
directions.case_file: Case file to be consigned to the Record Room after completion of prescribed codal formalities
